summary: GOT S8, Conversation in the Crypts
body:
GOT S8, Conversation in the Crypts

Arya:

Jon: [groaning] Daenerys and I are in love and related. It stinks to hear that Lord Stark had to lie to everyone to protect me. I’ve been wearing this same outfit for three fucking seasons now and I can’t freak out about my new found parentage and non-bastard status like I want to because the Night King is coming to literally end all of humanity. All of these new emotions I’m feeling are about to burst out of me, which might be super embarrassing…what if they come out my butt?

summary: Jon and Sansa’s close sibling relationship.
body:
Jon and Sansa’s close sibling relationship.

Sansa “I’ve had a lot of time to think about how awful I was to you”

…

Jon “You were occasionally awful.”

“I’m sure I can’t have been much fun always skulking in the corner watching the rest of you play. “

About the only thing the show runners decided was important enough to tell us about Jon and Sansa’s sibling relationship.


She was awful to him and they didn’t play together.

He’s never like Jon Snow particularly, but I think he might die for Sansa.

summary: My dad and I nearly had a full on argument this afternoon about Jon Snow’s parentage. Was my dad even watching the same show as...
body:
My dad and I nearly had a full on argument this afternoon about Jon Snow’s parentage. Was my dad even watching the same show as I was? Hahahaha! 

I wound up having to Google it because my dad would not have what I was saying. I’ve never been a ‘I told you so’ kind of person, but it does irritate me when people won’t back down on something, and then it turns out they were wrong anyway.

summary: What are you gonna do when Dany dies & Jon marries Sansa?
question: What are you gonna do when Dany dies & Jon marries Sansa?
answer:
How are you so sure that Sansa will live? As much as I love her, and the rest of the existing characters, none of them are invincible against the shitstorm that’s about to begin, certainly not Sansa. If you’re thinking about the possibility of Dany dying, then you also need to consider the possibility of Sansa dying, or in fact Jon. 

And speaking of Dany dying, she’s one of THE main characters in GOT and has a pivotal role in the story. If she’s going to die, you can be sure she won’t die that early on for Jon to even think about marrying Sansa. 

Oh, and they’re siblings, who have never looked at each romantically. So Jon marrying Sansa, won’t happen.

summary: Game of Thrones’ Final Season Release Date Announced
title: Game of Thrones’ Final Season Release Date Announced
body:
HBO has released a new teaser trailer for the final season of Games of Thrones which will premiere on April 14.

The new teaser shows Jon Snow (Kit Harrington), Sansa Stark (Sophie Turner), and Arya Stark (Maisie Williams) walking through the Winterfell’s crypts, meeting at the end of the tunnel where they find statues of themselves among the dead with the cold winter creeping in.

Game of Thrones: Season 8 will be the shortest season in the series, consisting of only 6 episodes, however, Ser Jorah Mormont actor Iain Glen has previously told Daily Express the episodes will be “feature-length”. 

It’s also been reported recently via Variety that the Game of Thrones prequel series has found its main cast. Naomi Watts and Josh Whitehouse will lead the series with Naomi Ackie, Denise Gough, Jamie Campbell Bower, Sheila Atim, Ivanno Jeremiah, Georgie Henley, Alex Sharp, and Toby Regbo joining as series regulars. The pilot will be directed by SJ Clarkson whose previous work includes Marvel’s Jessica Jones, Orange is the New Black and Dexter.

Game of Thrones’ The Final Season will premiere on HBO on April 14, 2019.

Opinion: Am I incredibly excited for the final season of Game of Thrones? Yes, absolutely. Are these recent teasers doing much for me? No, not really. Either give us one proper full trailer for the season or don’t. After the first trailer, I don’t think Avengers: Endgame needs another, that gave me everything I needed. And that’s how I feel about Game of Thrones.

Looking for more from me? Follow me on Twitter to keep up to date with my latest posts, video game related nonsense, or if you just want to say hey!

summary:
Main difference between Dany and Sansa?
Dany has the most hateful father for people. They always parallel between Aerys and...
body:
Main difference between Dany and Sansa?

Dany has the most hateful father for people. They always parallel between Aerys and Daenerys. Her father’s crime always overshadowed Dany. People thought that she was mad as her father. But she fought to deserve their respect, trust and love. People choice her because they love Dany. They respected Dany.she gave them hope and enthusiasm for fight.

And Sansa? She was always Daughter of the most honorable man. People always identified her with her father. She was always Ned Star’s Daughter. People always needed her because she was “Stark” . Ned Stark’s Daughter. Has she really her private success? Has she People’s love?

No! She is again Ned Stark’s Daughter.

Littlefinger used her because she is ned Stark’s Daughter and his chance in North.

Jon Told her on the wall. If I don’t protect you, my father never forgive me

Northern lords told her. You are Ned Stark’s daughter and you can be our queen.

In reality Sansa hasn’t her personality. She is always “Ned Stark’s Daughter ‘

Different from Dany. She always said

“I am Daenerys Targaryen “

Dany and Sansa are mirror characters.

Dany comes from hateful father-Sansa comes from adorable father.


I have most logical questions.

Northern people wanted Sansa as their queen because she is “Sansa Stark?” Or because she is “Ned Stark’s trueborn daughter”?

Answer is very clear.

blog.name: once-upon-an-animation
blog.title: All My Fandom Junk
blog.description: This is basically a dump for all the stuff I like. It's mostly HTTYD, but Frozen, The Lion King, Rise of the Guardians, Once Upon A Time, Avatar: The Last Airbender, Legend of Korra, and any other popular franchise can find its way here. I'm young and I'm...

summary: I feel like one thing people need to talk about more often is how people are going to respond to the validity of Jon’s heritage...
body:
I feel like one thing people need to talk about more often is how people are going to respond to the validity of Jon’s heritage reveal. I’m not just talking Danaerys and the Stark sibs, I’m talking the entirety of Westeros, including the Lannisters, The Greyjoys, the Martells, and other houses. 

Unless there is physical evidence that Jon is R&L’s son that I never noticed, Bran’s visions are the only thing they have to go off of, right? Is everyone going to buy into these visions and the  “Jon is the true heir” story? Aren’t people going to wonder at the legitimacy of the R+L=J theory, and be reluctant to accept that this theory is even true? That this “bastard” son of Ned Stark is suddenly the son of Rhaegar Targaryen and Lyanna Stark? Might they think it’s a wild attempt by the North (and maybe Daenerys) to gain power? Will they (the rest of Westeros) even want Jon to sit the throne and accept him as King, even if Dany legitimizes him or something? The North likes Jon, but does the rest of Westeros like or care for him at all?

I’m not super into monarchy structures or GOT details, so if y’all wanna contribute to this conversation, I’m down.

summary:
Daenerys Targaryen is the most popular Game Of Thrones character 
And House Targaryen and Lannister  is the most popular houses
